This is consistent with the evidence on the stagnation of median and mean wages in the US over a span of more than forty years, and a decline in mean and median wages of unskilled workers (e.g. workers with only a high school education).
This may, of course, also be true with other forms of market frictions, e.g. imperfect labor mobility. See, e.g. Delli Gatti et al 2012, 2013.
